message: Just hovering on the 'groups' menu at the top opens it, but clicking on it changes the page. This is a big interaction problem because I (like many people, I would guess) click on that menu to open it, and then the page changes a second later while I'm moving to the group I want.
Weird the group menu works for me on mouse over w/o clicking
IMHO, at least the ▼ on the right should show the groups menu when clicked, instead of pointing to the homepage.
i really don't see how the menu is a bad UX

@MarkLaViolette you mean it opens when you mouseover and don't click? that's the problem! Click on it anyway (like you would for many desktop menu systems), then start moving your mouse down the list as if you were choosing which group to go to
@tyrion you mean, exactly the way the username ▼ menu works on the top right corner? :) yes, that would be fine
Hmmm...we thought by adding the delay it would much better match user intent.  I think there's a UX term for this even--"Hover Intent"
I think the hover/click debate would be different if there weren't the delay between mouse-over and the menu dropping down.
I've also noticed that sometimes the menu disappears while you're moving your mouse over it
when there's a delay, it makes me think I need to click the link
This is good feedback guys, thanks
that groups menu has me all confused as well. I'm getting used to it but I have to stop my finger from clicking.
menus have to be clicked they don't open on hover.
also I just realized it behaves different than all the other ui elements in the top nav.
just wanted to add that I *still* can't stop myself from clicking the menu and being zapped to the homepage. so +1 from me
